name: The Return of Mr. Bean Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Before entering the department store, how does Mr. Bean get the money to give to a saxophone player?
options: He doesn't give the man any money
questions.explanation:
He dances.

	Mr. Bean decides that since he doesn't want to give the man a bill, he'll dance to the man's music.  A different passer-by give him change and Mr. Bean ends up giving that change to the musician.

questions.text: What type of credit card does Mr. Bean have?
questions.explanation:
American Express.

	Mr. Bean accidentally loses the card when he pays for his stuff, but he gets it back in the end of the vignette.  To get it back, he has to follow a man into a bathroom stall.

questions.text: What is the name of the department store that Mr. Bean shops at?
questions.explanation:
Alders.

	Alders is having a sale on the day that Mr. Bean shops there, and surprisingly, there aren't many customers in the store.  He decides to test nearly every item he buys.

questions.text: What does Mr. Bean not buy at the department store?
questions.explanation:
A hammer.

	Mr. Bean ends up testing all of his products to see if they work, so he uses a potato and a fish that he brought into the store to test a potato peeler and the frying pan.

questions.text: What does Mr. Bean end up giving himself at the restaurant?
questions.explanation:
A birthday card.

	Mr. Bean ends up eating dinner alone, but before the waiter arrives, he signs a card, sets it at the edge of his table, and opens it.  You can tell it's a birthday card because the violinist in the restaurant plays "Happy Birthday" for Mr. Bean.

questions.text: What does Mr. Bean end up eating at the restaurant?
questions.explanation:
Steak.

	Mr. Bean orders steak tartare, but he soon realizes that he doesn't like it, so he starts putting pieces of it in different places.  Some of these absurd places include in a flower vase, in a purse, and in a person's trousers.

questions.text: What is one place that Mr. Bean does not hide his food?
questions.explanation:
In his pocket.

	Mr. Bean ends up tripping the waiter and it makes it seem like all of the steak he had was everywhere.  The owner moved Mr. Bean to another table where he was given more steak tartare on the house.

questions.text: What does Mr. Bean not do in his preparation to meet royalty?
questions.explanation:
Comb his hair.

	In the end, Mr. Bean ends up bowing and and accidentally knocking the royal woman onto the floor.  Mr. Bean runs away before anyone catches him.

questions.text: How does the librarian know that Mr. Bean ruined the book in "The Library" vignette?
questions.correct: Mr. Bean left his bookmark in the book
options: Mr. Bean wrote his name in the book
He saw Mr. Bean ruin the book
questions.explanation:
Mr. Bean left his bookmark in the book

	Mr. Bean coloured in the book by accident, so he used Tipp-ex (white-out) in the book, but the pages stuck, and he had to rip them out.  He ended up cutting out many pages of the priceless book.

questions.text: Does Mr. Bean encounter the three-wheeled car at all during these vignettes?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The next time Mr. Bean sees the three-wheeled car is when he goes to the swimming pool in the next episode.  Mr. Bean has a personal vendetta against the ugly three-wheeler that always seems to pop up on the show.
